intro: Bilabrella hochstetteriana, commonly known as the Hochstetter's bilabrella, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a shrub-like structure with narrow, leathery leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are adapted to attract specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
